meico.mpm.elements.maps.data

Class DynamicsData

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.mpm.elements.maps.data.DynamicsData

  • public class DynamicsData
extends java.lang.Object
    this class is used to collect all relevant data to compute articulation
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DynamicsData clone()
      create a copy of this object
      private void computeInnerControlPointsXPositions()
      For continuous dynamics transitions the dynamics curve is constructed from a cubic, S-shaped Bézier curve (P0, P1, P2, P3): _/̅ This method derives the x-coordinates of the inner two control points from the values of curvature and protraction.
      private double[] getDateDynamics(double t)
      this method works directly with the parameter t to specify a point on the Bézier curve and returns a tuplet [date, volume]
      double getDynamicsAt(double date)
      compute the dynamics value at the given tick position
      java.util.ArrayList<double[]> getSubNoteDynamicsSegment(double maxStepSize)
      This method generates a list of [date, volume] tuplets that can be rendered into a sequence of channelVolume events.
      private double getTForDate(double date)
      compute parameter t of the Bézier curve that corresponds to time position date
      boolean isConstantDynamics()

      • isConstantDynamics

      • computeInnerControlPointsXPositions

        private void computeInnerControlPointsXPositions()
        For continuous dynamics transitions the dynamics curve is constructed from a cubic, S-shaped Bézier curve (P0, P1, P2, P3): _/̅ This method derives the x-coordinates of the inner two control points from the values of curvature and protraction. All other coordinates are fixed.

      • getTForDate

        private double getTForDate(double date)
        compute parameter t of the Bézier curve that corresponds to time position date
        Parameters:
        date - time position
        Returns:

        private double[] getDateDynamics(double t)

        Returns:

      • getSubNoteDynamicsSegment

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[]> getSubNoteDynamicsSegment(double maxStepSize)
        This method generates a list of [date, volume] tuplets that can be rendered into a sequence of channelVolume events.
        Parameters:
        maxStepSize - this sets the maximum volume step size between two adjacent tuplets
        Returns:
